abstract.text: Welcome to the Audit Manager API reference. This guide is for developers who need detailed information about the Audit Manager API operations, data types, and errors. Audit Manager is a service that provides automated evidence collection so that you can continually audit your Amazon Web Services usage. You can use it to assess the effectiveness of your controls, manage risk, and simplify compliance. Audit Manager provides prebuilt frameworks that structure and automate assessments for a given compliance standard. Frameworks include a prebuilt collection of controls with descriptions and testing procedures. These controls are grouped according to the requirements of the specified compliance standard or regulation. You can also customize frameworks and controls to support internal audits with specific requirements. Use the following links to get started with the Audit Manager API:
Returns the URL of an assessment report in Audit Manager.
Updates a control within an assessment in Audit Manager.
Returns a list of evidence folders that are associated with a specified control of an assessment in Audit Manager.
Disassociates an evidence folder from the specified assessment report in Audit Manager.
Updates the status of an assessment in Audit Manager.
Removes a tag from a resource in Audit Manager.
Associates a list of evidence to an assessment report in an Audit Manager assessment.
Creates an assessment report for the specified assessment.
Updates a custom framework in Audit Manager.
Creates an assessment in Audit Manager.
Creates a batch of delegations for an assessment in Audit Manager.
Deletes an assessment report in Audit Manager. When you run the DeleteAssessmentReport operation, Audit Manager attempts to delete the following data:
Gets the latest analytics data for all your current active assessments.
Updates Audit Manager settings for the current user account.
Returns a list of changelogs from Audit Manager.

Welcome to the Audit Manager API reference. This guide is for developers who need detailed information about the Audit Manager API operations, data types, and errors. Audit Manager is a service that provides automated evidence collection so that you can continually audit your Amazon Web Services usage. You can use it to assess the effectiveness of your controls, manage risk, and simplify compliance. Audit Manager provides prebuilt frameworks that structure and automate assessments for a given compliance standard. Frameworks include a prebuilt collection of controls with descriptions and testing procedures. These controls are grouped according to the requirements of the specified compliance standard or regulation. You can also customize frameworks and controls to support internal audits with specific requirements. Use the following links to get started with the Audit Manager API:
Associates an evidence folder to an assessment report in a Audit Manager assessment.
Returns the settings for the specified Amazon Web Services account.
Returns a framework from Audit Manager.
Returns an assessment from Audit Manager.
Updates a share request for a custom framework in Audit Manager.
Returns the registration status of an account in Audit Manager.
Deletes a batch of delegations for an assessment in Audit Manager.
Returns a list of the frameworks that are available in the Audit Manager framework library.
Returns a list of all of the Amazon Web Services that you can choose to include in your assessment. When you
, specify which of these services you want to include to narrow the assessmentâ€™s
Returns the name of the delegated Amazon Web Services administrator account for the organization.
Enables an Amazon Web Services account within the organization as the delegated administrator for Audit Manager.
Edits an Audit Manager assessment.
Returns a list of assessment reports created in Audit Manager.
Validates the integrity of an assessment report in Audit Manager.
Returns all evidence from a specified evidence folder in Audit Manager.

Lists the latest analytics data for control domains across all of your active assessments. A control domain is listed only if at least one of the controls within that domain collected evidence on the lastUpdated date of controlDomainInsights. If this condition isnâ€™t met, no data is listed for that control domain.
Deletes a custom framework in Audit Manager.
Creates a new custom control in Audit Manager.
Creates a custom framework in Audit Manager.
Tags the specified resource in Audit Manager.
Deletes an assessment in Audit Manager.
Deletes a share request for a custom framework in Audit Manager.
Enables Audit Manager for the specified Amazon Web Services account.
Returns a list of current and past assessments from Audit Manager.

Deregisters an account in Audit Manager. When you deregister your account from Audit Manager, your data isnâ€™t deleted. If you want to delete your resource data, you must perform that task separately before you deregister your account. Either, you can do this in the Audit Manager console. Or, you can use one of the delete API operations that are provided by Audit Manager. To delete your Audit Manager resource data, see the following instructions:
Returns a list of controls from Audit Manager.

Removes the specified Amazon Web Services account as a delegated administrator for Audit Manager. When you remove a delegated administrator from your Audit Manager settings, you continue to have access to the evidence that you previously collected under that account. This is also the case when you deregister a delegated administrator from Organizations. However, Audit Manager will stop collecting and attaching evidence to that delegated administrator account moving forward. Keep in mind the following cleanup task if you use evidence finder: Before you use your management account to remove a delegated administrator, make sure that the current delegated administrator account signs in to Audit Manager and disables evidence finder first. Disabling evidence finder automatically deletes the event data store that was created in their account when they enabled evidence finder. If this task isnâ€™t completed, the event data store remains in their account. In this case, we recommend that the original delegated administrator goes to CloudTrail Lake and manually

. This cleanup task is necessary to ensure that you donâ€™t end up with multiple event data stores. Audit Manager will ignore an unused event data store after you remove or change a delegated administrator account. However, the unused event data store continues to incur storage costs from CloudTrail Lake if you donâ€™t delete it. When you deregister a delegated administrator account for Audit Manager, the data for that account isnâ€™t deleted. If you want to delete resource data for a delegated administrator account, you must perform that task separately before you deregister the account. Either, you can do this in the Audit Manager console. Or, you can use one of the delete API operations that are provided by Audit Manager. To delete your Audit Manager resource data, see the following instructions:
Updates the status of a control set in an Audit Manager assessment.
Returns a list of keywords that are pre-mapped to the specified control data source.

Lists analytics data for control domains within a specified active assessment. A control domain is listed only if at least one of the controls within that domain collected evidence on the lastUpdated date of controlDomainInsights. If this condition isnâ€™t met, no data is listed for that domain.
Returns a list of all Audit Manager notifications.
Disassociates a list of evidence from an assessment report in Audit Manager.

Uploads one or more pieces of evidence to a control in an Audit Manager assessment. You can upload manual evidence from any Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket by specifying the S3 URI of the evidence. You must upload manual evidence to your S3 bucket before you can upload it to your assessment. For instructions, see
and
in the Amazon Simple Storage Service API Reference. The following restrictions apply to this action:
Returns a list of sent or received share requests for custom frameworks in Audit Manager.
Returns a list of delegations from an audit owner to a delegate.
Gets the latest analytics data for a specific active assessment.

Creates a share request for a custom framework in Audit Manager. The share request specifies a recipient and notifies them that a custom framework is available. Recipients have 120 days to accept or decline the request. If no action is taken, the share request expires. When you create a share request, Audit Manager stores a snapshot of your custom framework in the US East (N. Virginia) Amazon Web Services Region. Audit Manager also stores a backup of the same snapshot in the US West (Oregon) Amazon Web Services Region. Audit Manager deletes the snapshot and the backup snapshot when one of the following events occurs:

Lists the latest analytics data for controls within a specific control domain across all active assessments. Control insights are listed only if the control belongs to the control domain that was specified and the control collected evidence on the lastUpdated date of controlInsightsMetadata. If neither of these conditions are met, no data is listed for that control.
Deletes a custom control in Audit Manager.
Returns a list of tags for the specified resource in Audit Manager.
Returns evidence from Audit Manager.
Returns an evidence folder from the specified assessment in Audit Manager.
Updates a custom control in Audit Manager.
Returns a control from Audit Manager.
Returns the evidence folders from a specified assessment in Audit Manager.

Lists the latest analytics data for controls within a specific control domain and a specific active assessment. Control insights are listed only if the control belongs to the control domain and assessment that was specified. Moreover, the control must have collected evidence on the lastUpdated date of controlInsightsByAssessment. If neither of these conditions are met, no data is listed for that control.
